TypePtr<T>& isis::data::_internal::TypePtrBase::cast_to_TypePtr (  )  [inline]

Dynamically cast the TypeBase up to its actual TypePtr<T>.

Referenced version. Will send an error if T is not the actual type and _ENABLE_CORE_LOG is true.

Returns:
a reference of the pointer.

Definition at line 62 of file typeptr_base.cpp.

template<typename T>
TypePtr<T> isis::data::_internal::TypePtrBase::copyToNew (  )  const [inline]

Copy this to a new TypePtr<T> using newly allocated memory.

This will create a new TypePtr of type T and the length of this. The memory will be allocated and the data of this will be copy-converted to T. If the conversion fails, an error will be send to CoreLog and the data of the newly created TypePtr will be undefined.

Returns:
a the newly created TypePtr

Definition at line 114 of file typeptr_base.hpp.

template<typename T>
TypePtr<T> isis::data::_internal::TypePtrBase::copyToNew ( const scaling_pair &  scaling  )  const [inline]

Copy this to a new TypePtr<T> using newly allocated memory.

This will create a new TypePtr of type T and the length of this. The memory will be allocated and the data of this will be copy-converted to T using min/max as value range. If the conversion fails, an error will be send to CoreLog and the data of the newly created TypePtr will be undefined.

Returns:
a the newly created TypePtr

Definition at line 27 of file typeptr_base.cpp.

virtual void isis::data::_internal::TypePtrBase::getMinMax ( util::TypeReference &  min,
util::TypeReference &  max 
) const [pure virtual]

Get minimum/maximum from a TypePtr.

The parameters are reverences to the current maximum/minimum found. max will be replaced by a value from the array if:

  • max is empty
  • max is less than that value from the array

min will be replaced by a value from the array if:

  • min is empty
  • min is greater than that value from the array

Note, that min/max will also adopt the type of the value.

Parameters:
max TypeBase::Reference for the current greatest value
min TypeBase::Reference for the current lowest value

Implemented in isis::data::TypePtr< TYPE >.

Definition at line 18 of file typeptr_base.cpp.

virtual std::vector<Reference> isis::data::_internal::TypePtrBase::splice ( size_t  size  )  const [pure virtual]

Split up into cheap copies of given length.

This will create TypePtr's which will point at elements within this data block.

  • They will have a distance of size and therefore have the have the same length (exept the last one which will point an the rest).
  • They will use a special proxy-reference-counting (If at least one of them is still used, the whole original TypePtr will be kept).
    Returns:
    a vector of ceil(len()/size) not intersecting TypePtrBase::Reference's of the length<=size.

Implemented in isis::data::TypePtr< TYPE >.
